message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.PL. 

The paper deals with a constraint-based formalism for temporal planning, which is a common topic in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also introduces a novel connection with Mean Payoff Games, which are well-known in the area of formal verification and model-checking, suggesting a possible fit with the cs.LO (logic in computer science) and cs.DS (data structures and algorithms) categories. The paper also discusses the complexity of the problem of checking dynamic consistency, which is a common theme in computational complexity theory, suggesting a possible fit with the cs.GT (computational complexity) category. Finally, the paper deals with a formalism for temporal planning, which is a common topic in programming languages and compilers, suggesting a possible fit with the cs.PL (programming languages) category.
